repnme.cdata!:
Social sphere : concentrating efforts on
            hot spots

abstracts.cdata!:
How to alleviate the impact of market
            transformations on the most vulnerable strata of the
            population? What, in general, a new strategy and social
            protection mechanisms should be in Ukraine? These questions
            have been for quite some time in the focus of great
            attention of the World Bank experts. The World Bank fist
            project in this area - the social protection support project
            (April 1997 - June 2000) had a rather modest budget of
            United States (U.S.) 3 million dollars, but it had a
            considerable social effect. This will improve the
            administering of the program of the public housing and
            utilities subsidies (PHUSP), which was in force at that time
            in Ukraine and caused many complaints due to cumbersome
            (non-automated) system of processing applications, lack of
            experience among the staff, absence of operational
            communication between relevant local and regional agencies
            and the ministry of labor and social policy of Ukraine. The
            next project - the social investment fund project - approved
            by the Board of Executive Directors of the World Bank on
            December 4, 2001, is, perhaps, one of the most successful
            projects today. It is expected that during the six years of
            this joint Ukraine-World Bank activities, over 500 micro
            projects can be implemented aimed at supporting the
            residents of poor or depressed areas, citizens with specific
            problems, children from unhappy families, and the like. And
            at the national level, it is necessary to refine the
            principles of providing such poverty-targeted assistance and
            self-aid by involving the public at large in these
            activities. In December 2002, the Board of Executive
            Directors of the World Bank approved yet another important
            project - tuberculosis (TB) and acquired immunodeficiency
            syndrome (AIDS) epidemic control project for Ukraine.

abstracts.cdata!:
Overall achievement of project
            objectives is assessed as satisfactory while project
            sustainability overall is highly satisfactory. Both World
            Bank and Borrower performances are considered satisfactory
            overall. Lessons learned included the following: Successful
            implementation of the project can be attributed to the fact
            that the Bank and USAID/PADCO (Planning and Development
            Collaborative International) teams worked closely with the
            Ministry on almost all aspects of implementation of the
            housing subsidy program. Although computerization of
            administratiive systems have been introduced as
            free-standing Bank projects, procurement of computers
            without appropriate software and adequate capacity building
            would not have accomplished any of the project objectives.
            Training staff in the use of computer technologies and in
            the management of information exchange was crucial for the
            project's success. Staffing limitations of the Housing
            and Municipal Services Allowance Program (HMSAP) at national
            and regional levels and financing restrictions imposed on
            the Ministry of Labor and Social Policy (MLSP) have not
            allowed them to fully develop information management
            activities that monitor and evaluate programs. For more
            comprehensive projects related to automation of
            administrative systems, the establishment of a formal
            project implementation unit is advisable.

            PROTECTION & SERVICES,TF036931-UKRAINE - SOCIAL PROTECTION SUPP.
5082943.majtheme: Public sector governance,Social protection and risk management

abstracts.cdata!:
The Social Protection Support Project
            aims to improve the administration of the Housing and
            Municipal Service Allowance Program (HMSAP) by: 1)
            automating the processing of applications and data in the
            administrative offices; and 2) piloting a system to
            electronically link the local HMSAP administrative offices,
            the regional HMSAP offices and the Ministry of Social
            Protection (MSP) and monitor and evaluate the effectiveness
            of the program. The project will include the installation of
            hardware and training of staff in system operations and will
            consist of: 1) automation of data processing in HMSAP
            administrative offices; 2) management information system; 3)
            training and technical support; and 4) project
            administration, monitoring and evaluation.
